fork.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a tool you use for picking up and eating food, with a handle and three or four points
fork.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Put the knives and forks on the table.
fork.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a garden tool used for digging, with a handle and three or four points
fork.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a place where a road, river, or tree divides into two parts, or one of the parts it divides into
fork.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: the north fork of the Sacramento river
Take the left fork then go straight on.
fork.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: one of the two metal bars between which the front wheel of a bicycle or motorcycle is fixed
fork.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: if a road, river etc forks, it divides into two parts
fork.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The path forked off in two directions.
fork.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to put food into your mouth or onto a plate using a fork
fork.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: He forked some bacon into his mouth.
fork.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to put manure into soil or to move soil around using a large garden fork
fork.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: In November, the soil should be forked over.
